<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug Report</denchmark-h>
TensorboardLogger in batch logger mode displays horizontal axis by samples, which is inconvenient. <denchmark-h:h3>How To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
import logger from catalyst.dl.callbacks import TensorboardLogger make TensorboardLogger callback with batch logger mode calback_tb = TensorboardLogger(metric_names=["loss"], log_on_batch_end=True) add callback into runner runner.train(model=model, criterion=criterion, optimizer=optimizer, callbacks=[calback_tb])
<denchmark-h:h4>Screenshots</denchmark-h>
In Tensorboard i have that plot: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20914357/89558668-2b47d300-d81d-11ea-9af7-f3ef13ad2b42.png></denchmark-link>
Horizontal axis displays amount of samples (10k samples overall), I guess it should show amount of batches. <denchmark-h:h4>How to fix</denchmark-h>
To fix it, you can change the step parameter in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/catalyst-team/catalyst/blob/34a69e568c69ab1eb364fc1646623f75756c82d2/catalyst/core/callbacks/logging.py#L220>that</denchmark-link> line from to
